What is the fundamental role of cumulative hydrogen bonding in the self-assembly of p-aminophenyl disulfide (p-APDS) vesicles?
A. It prevents the disassembly of p-APDS vesicles into individual molecules.
B. It enhances the solubility of p-APDS in organic solvents.
C. It decreases the fluorescence intensity of the microtubes.
D. It allows for the formation of microtubes by facilitating the self-organization of the vesicles and their subsequent fusion.

text: It prevents the disassembly of p-APDS vesicles into individual molecules.
It enhances the solubility of p-APDS in organic solvents.
It decreases the fluorescence intensity of the microtubes.
It allows for the formation of microtubes by facilitating the self-organization of the vesicles and their subsequent fusion.
label: A
B
C
D

answer: It allows for the formation of microtubes by facilitating the self-organization of the vesicles and their subsequent fusion.
